__e: He didn't know about the bomb or what I was up to, but... he said whatever it was, it wasn't worth it.
And I imagined that saving this society from war was worth turning my back on everything and everyone that I loved.
Because for the first time in my life, I had something worth living for, something to lose.
He didn't know about the bomb or what I was up to, but... he said whatever it was, it wasn't worth it.
And I imagined that saving this society from war was worth turning my back on everything and everyone that I loved.
Because for the first time in my life, I had something worth living for, something to lose.
And the idea that suddenly our voice, our judgement should count for nothing?
So I was in there, waitin' to die too, and I realized my life wasn't worth nothing.
When I was little, my mother always told me I was worth nothing.
